The Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program is offered at George Brown College. Graduates may qualify for further graduate studies in relevant areas such as design, interaction design, digital/interactive media, human computer interaction, e-learning, game design, interactive arts, and critical practice. Students who have completed the second or third year of the Interaction Design and Development Advanced Diploma with a grade point average of 3.2 or higher may be eligible to enter a degree completion pathway.

Required courses for the Digital Experience Design program include:
- BDES 1000: Design Tools 1: Digital Visualization in 2D Environments (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1001: Digital Systems and Software (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1002: Drawing 1: Introduction to Observational Drawing (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1003: Introduction to Digital Experience Design (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1004: Communicating for Design (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1200: Design Thinking (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1201: Design Culture and Theory (no prerequisite)
- BDES 1202: Drawing 2: Drawing Techniques in Digital Environments (prerequisites: BDES 1002 and BDES 1000)
- BDES 1203: Introduction to Human Computer Interaction (no prerequisite)
- Lower Liberal Studies Elective (no prerequisite, semester 3)

For more information, contact digitalexperience@georgebrown.ca or call 416-415-5000, ext. 3129.

- They may be considered based on post-secondary credits, but only certain credits are accepted.
- They will be invited to complete the application questionnaire and submit a portfolio electronically. Details on the application questionnaire and portfolio requirements will be communicated at a later date.
